name.livitski.tools.xml.staxform

Interface XMLEventProcessor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterator<XMLEvent>, XMLEventConsumer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConditionalEventProcessor, EventProcessorChain, IdentityEventProcessor, NullEventProcessor, XMLEventTransformer.XMLHeaderProcessor

    public interface XMLEventProcessor
extends XMLEventConsumer, Iterator<XMLEvent>
    A simple contract for user-defined transformations of XML events. XML input is pushed into the processor via the XMLEventConsumer.add(XMLEvent) method. Once the processor has output ready, it returns true from Iterator.hasNext() and furnishes its results via Iterator.next(). The callers may post zero, one, or more XML events to the processor before polling it for output. Processors do not have to yield any output until they receive the required input. They MUST, however, retain all the output they create in its original sequence until polled or reset, regardless of any extra input they may receive before being polled. Processors MAY throw an XMLStreamException from the XMLEventConsumer.add(XMLEvent) method if they run out of resources needed to store the input.
    Implementors are NOT expected to support the Iterator.remove() method which currently has no meaning when applied to this interface.
    Implementors may extend, or delegate to, an instance of IdentityEventProcessor to store the events they produce until polled.

      Fields

      static String DEBUG_PROPERTY
      Set the debug system property to true to see the complete stack trace of an error when it occurs.
